name: Shrugs, Dumbbells
how_to_perform:
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand, allowing your palms to face towards your thighs.
2. Keeping your back straight and core engaged, bend at the hips slightly so that your torso is leaning forward at a comfortable angle.

3. Slowly lift both dumbbells outwards away from your body, with your arms as straight as possible, squeezing your shoulder blades together and keeping your elbows high.

4. Hold this position for a brief moment (about 1-2 seconds), focusing on the contraction in your upper back muscles.

5. Then slowly lower the dumbbells back to their starting position at your sides.
6. Perform the desired number of repetitions, resting briefly between sets.
short_summary: Shrugs with dumbbells is an exercise that targets the trapezius muscle and other scapular stabilizers.
